sentences.text: Dear Fellow Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Mettler-Toledo International Inc. to be held on Thursday, May 4, 2017, at 8:00 a.m. at the offices of Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson LLP on 375 Park Avenue, New York, New York.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretarys notice of the meeting and the proxy statement which appear on the following pages describe the matters to be acted upon at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have distributed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials instead of delivering paper copies to shareholders who have elected to receive such notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice provides information about accessing the proxy materials online and describes the voting methods available to all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders receiving the notice will also have the opportunity to request a paper copy of the proxy materials through the instructions provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholders that do not receive the notice will receive a paper copy of all proxy materials through the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To change the way you receive proxy statements in the future please make a request in the appropriate space on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please sign and return your proxy as soon as possible so that your vote will be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote over the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely yours,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert F. Spoerry Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS FOR THE ANNUAL MEETING TO BE HELD ON MAY 4, 2017: This proxy statement and our 2016 Annual Report are available at the Internet address set out on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend this annual meeting, please complete the enclosed proxy card and promptly return it i the accompanying envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote over the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions on your prox card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement is furnished in connection with the solicitation of proxies by Mettler-Toledo International Inc. on behalf of the Board of Directors for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ABOUT THE MEETING AND VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals to be Voted On
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders will vote on the following proposals at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has not received proper notice of, and is not aware of, any additional business to be transacted at the meeting other than as indicated below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of nine directors for one-year terms
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the companys independent registered public accounting firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Advisory vote to approve executive compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes to approve executive compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We know of no other matter to be brought before the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If other matters requiring a vote of the shareholders come before the meeting, it is the intention of the persons named in the proxy to vote the proxies with respect to those matters in accordance with their reasonable judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders Entitled to Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock outstanding as of the close of business on March 6, 2017 (the record date), is entitled to one vote at the annual meeting on each matter properly brought before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the record date, 25,905,588 shares of common stock were outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum needs to be present at the meeting in order to hold the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum is a majority of the companys outstanding shares of common stock as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares are counted as present at the meeting if you attend the meeting and vote in person, vote by Internet, vote by telephone, or properly return a proxy card by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions shall also be counted in determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide a proxy or vote the shares yourself, your shares will not be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies that are signed and returned but do not contain instructions will be voted FOR proposals one, two, and three, and for a frequency of every year for proposal four.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How to Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BY PROXY  You may vote your shares by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote your shares by proxy, you are legally designating another person to vote your shares in accordance with your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote by proxy, complete, sign, and return the enclosed proxy card by mail as described on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may vote over the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IN PERSON  You may vote your shares by attending the meeting and voting your shares in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting is being held at the offices of Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson LLP at the address indicated in the Notice to Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the meeting, we encourage you to vote your shares by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will enable us to receive votes in advance of the meeting to ensure that a quorum is present for the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote by proxy and subsequently decide to change your vote, you may revoke your proxy at any time before the polls close at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, you may only do this by signing another proxy with a later date, completing a written notice of revocation and returning it to the address on the proxy card before the meeting, or voting in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Tabulation; Voting Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company appoints an independent inspector of election, who also tabulates the voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meetings voting results will be disclosed promptly following the meeting in a Form 8-K filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL ONE: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees for the Board of Directors are listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If elected, each nominee will hold office until next years annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors have been duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees are currently directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has no reason to believe any nominee would be unable or unwilling to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a nominee is unable to serve, the persons designated as proxyholders for the company will vote for the remaining nominees and for such other persons the Board of Directors may nominate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director is elected if a majority of the votes cast with respect to the director are voted FOR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the number of nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected, a director is elected by the affirmative vote of a plurality of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes cast shall include votes for or against a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An abstention shall not count as a vote cast with respect to a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a majority fails to reelect an incumbent director when a majority vote is required, he or she shall continue to serve until the next annual meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected; or until the Board of Directors accepts his or her resignation or removes him or her, if earlier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board of Directors accepts an incumbent directors resignation, or if a non-incumbent nominee for director is not elected, the Board of Directors, in its sole discretion, may fill any resulting vacancy, or may decrease the size of the Board of Directors, in each case pursuant to the provisions of Sections 1 and 2 of Article II of the companys by-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications of Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of our Board of Directors have had diverse backgrounds and experiences during the course of their careers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These individual backgrounds and experiences better enable the board to perform its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wah-Hui Chu is 65 years old and has been a director since January 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He serves on the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Masters in Business Administration from Roosevelt University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, Mr. Chu served as Chief Executive Officer of Tingyi Asahi Beverages, the largest soft drink company in China with over $6 billion in revenue, and was its Executive Director until February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a Director of Li Ning Company Limited from July 2007 through December 2012; and was Executive Director and Chief Executive Officer of Next Media Limited, the leading publicly traded media company in Hong Kong that focuses on the greater China region, from October 2008 to October 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served as Chairman of PepsiCo Investment (China) Limited from January 1999 to March 2007 and again from March 2012 to December 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chu spent many years as an executive at PepsiCo, serving as: non-executive Chairman of PepsiCo Internationals Asia Region from April 2007 to April 2008; and President of PepsiCo International  China Beverages Business Unit from March 1998 to March 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chu has extensive professional experience in management positions at leading U.S. companies Asian businesses, having spent a substantial majority of his time since 1980 in Asia with Quaker Oats Company, H.J. Heinz Company, Whirlpool Corporation, Monsanto Company, and PepsiCo.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has significant operations in Asia and is making significant investments in Asia, particularly China, and a person with Mr. Chus background provides valuable assistance and insight to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Francis A. Contino is 71 years old and has been a director since October 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is considered one of the boards financial experts, and serves as Chairman of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been Managing Director of FAC&B LLC since July 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Contino spent many years as an executive at McCormick & Company, Inc., a global leader in the manufacture and distribution of spices, seasoning mixes, condiments, and other products to the food industry, over a period in which it grew to more than $3 billion in sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served McCormick as: a member of the Management Committee, Executive Vice President and a member of the Board of Directors from 1998 to 2008; Chief Financial Officer from 1998 through October 2007; and Executive Vice President responsible for Supply Chain from 2002 to 2004 and responsible for Strategy from 2004 to 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining McCormick, Mr. Contino was Managing Partner of the Baltimore office of Ernst & Young.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL ONE: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Contino has extensive financial experience from his background as a Certified Public Accountant, his 20-year tenure as an Audit Partner at Ernst & Young, where he served as coordinating partner for large multinational public companies, and from his 10-year service as the Chief Financial Officer of McCormick & Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With his experience at McCormick, Mr. Contino also brings valuable insights into the food sector, which is a key end-user market for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Olivier A. Filliol is 50 years old and has been a director since January 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Masters (lic. oec.) and Ph.D. (Dr. oec.) in Business Administration from the University of St. Gallen, Switzerland, and has completed executive education at the Business School of Stanford University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been President and Chief Executive Officer of the company since January 1, 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to his current role with the company, Mr. Filliol served the company as: Head of Global Sales, Service and Marketing from April 2004 to December 2007; Head of Process Analytics from June 1999 to December 2007; and General Manager of the U.S. checkweighing operations from June 1998 to June 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining the company, Mr. Filliol was a Strategy Consultant with the international consulting firm Bain & Company working in the Geneva, Paris, and Sydney offices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Filliol has broad experience across many of the companys businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He led one of the companys divisions over an eight year period and he was the principal architect behind the companys growth initiative in sales and marketing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has particular strengths in both strategy development and execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As CEO of the company, Mr. Filliol also brings the board the necessary insights into understanding the global operations of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard Francis is 48 years old and has been a director since May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from th Manchester Metropolitan University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been Division Head and Chief Executive Officer of Sandoz, the Generics Division o Novartis, since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to his current position, Mr. Francis spent 13 years at Biogen Idec, where he held various global and country leadership positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Immediately prior to leaving Biogen in 2014, Mr. Francis was Senior Vice President of their US Commercial organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1998 to 2001, he held various marketing roles at Sanofi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Francis has in-depth knowledge of the generics, pharmaceutical, and biotechnology industry sectors, which are important market segments for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also has significant leadership and international expertise and will provide useful insights to our global organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Constance L. Harvey is 55 years old and has been a director since July 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She serves on the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from Iowa State University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Harvey was an executive with Conduent (formerly Xerox Services) since 2001, most recently serving as Chief Operating Officer, Commercial Healthcare Business Group starting in 2014 and Vice President starting in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She held both positions until her retirement in January 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that she served as Chief Operating Officer for Commercial Business Process Outsourcing starting in 2011, and before that Group President of the healthcare payer and insurance delivery unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In her role at Conduent, Ms. Harvey developed strong leadership experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Her group encompassed service offerings for the healthcare industry including payers, providers, and pharmaceutical and life science companies, some of which are key end-user markets for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also has significant experience in relevant topics, including business process engineering and building a service business through organic growth and mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael A. Kelly is 60 years old and has been a director since July 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He serves on the Audit and Compensation Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has completed executive education at The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a Director of HERC Holdings Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL ONE: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kelly spent many years as an executive at 3M Company, serving as Executive Vice President of the Electronics and Energy Business from October 2012 to January 2016, and Executive Vice President of the Display and Graphics Business from October 2006 to October 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served in various management positions in the U.S., Singapore, Korea, and Germany since he joined 3M in 1981.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his role as the Executive Vice President of 3Ms Electronics and Energy Business, Mr. Kelly had global responsibility for all operational and strategic elements of a $6 billion business, including the Electronic Materials, Electrical Markets, Communications Markets, Renewable Energy, and Display Materials Systems Businesses of 3M.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kellys business also encompassed all film manufacturing for 3M.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of running this complex and highly technical set of global businesses, Mr. Kelly has experience in several topics relevant to the company, including strategic planning, restructuring, shifting business focus to emerging markets, and operational matters generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hans Ulrich Maerki is 70 years old and has been a director since September 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He serves on the Compensation Committee and as Chairman of the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Masters in Business Administration from the University of Basel, Switzerland, and a 2010 Senior Fellowship of Advanced Leadership at Harvard University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maerki spent many years as an executive at IBM, serving as the: Chairman of IBM Europe/Middle East/Africa (EMEA) from August 2001 to March 2008; Chief Executive Officer of IBM EMEA from July 2003 to May 2005; General Manager of IBM Global Services, EMEA from 1996 to July 2001; and various other positions at IBM beginning in 1973.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was a director at ABB Ltd. for 12 years, from 2002 until 2014, and at Swiss Re for nine years, from 2007 to March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his 35-year tenure at IBM, including ultimately running a business with approximately $35 billion in revenue across 124 countries, Mr. Maerki has made extensive contributions in addressing service, software, and other IT-related topics, and also has deep experience in marketing and sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are areas of increasing importance to the companys business, and as a result this experience is very relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By virtue of his service on the board of ABB, Mr. Maerki also had insight into the industrial end-user market, which is another key market for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas P. Salice is 57 years old and has been a director since October 1996.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is considered one of the boards financial experts, and serves on the Audit Committee and as Chairman of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Masters in Business Administration from Harvard University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice is a co-founder, principal, and Managing Member of SFW Capital Partners, LLC, a private equity firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a Director of Waters Corporation and the privately-held companies Essen Bioscience, Inc., Filtec, Gerson Lehrman Group, and Spectro Scientific Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice has been a Managing Member of SFW Capital Partners since January 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From June 1989 to December 2004, he served in a variety of capacities with AEA Investors, Inc., including Managing Director, President and Chief Executive Officer, and Vice-Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice has more than 25 years private equity experience, including as an investor in the analytical tools sectors and related service businesses, which has given him extensive operational, industry, and strategic knowledge in key company business areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice led the team at AEA Investors in the acquisition of the company in 1996 and has served on the board since that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice has in-depth experience in strategic planning, corporate finance, investor relations, mergers and acquisitions, and other topics that are relevant to the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert F. Spoerry is 61 years old and has been a director since October 1996.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been Chairman of the Board of Directors of the company since May 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a Masters in Mechanical Engineering from the Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich, Switzerland, and a Master of Business Administration from the University of Chicago.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL ONE: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry was President and Chief Executive Officer of the company from 1993 to 2007 and served as its Executive Chairman in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry is also a Director of Conzzeta Holding AG, and Sonova Holding AG, where he has served as Chairman since March 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry was previously a Director of Geberit AG, from 2009 to April 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the former President and CEO of the company, Mr. Spoerry has long-standing experience in the global precision instrument industry and a deep knowledge of the company, including its organization, products, markets, customers, and competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has a strong technical background and experience with innovation-driven companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry has broad international experience across industries and businesses relevant to the company, including by virtue of his service on several other boards of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry devotes a substantial amount of his time to his service as Chairman of the Board and other specific duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His deep understanding of the company, its markets, customers, and competitors, which was developed over more than thirty years of service, is a unique and valuable qualification that we believe provides a substantial benefit to the company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the election of each of the directors listed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies will be voted FOR each nominee unless otherwise specified in the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS  GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition of the Board; Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys by-laws require the Board of Directors to consist of between five and ten directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the annual meeting, the number of directors will be fixed at nine, consisting of a Chairman, the CEO, and seven independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director holds a one-year term until the next annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has three committees: the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary tasks of the board include oversight of the companys strategy and governance matters, review of the companys financial matters, and evaluation of how the company executes against objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managements tasks include setting strategy and running the companys operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company believes having a separate CEO and Chairman allows the Chairman to function as an important liaison between management and the board, helping ensure the board fulfills its oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure the board has sufficient independence, the board has also established a lead independent director (the Presiding Director) who oversees executive sessions of the independent directors and all meetings of directors at which the Chairman is not present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Salice currently serves as the Presiding Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has established corporate governance guidelines that contribute to the overall operating framework of the board and the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines cover topics including director qualifications, the director nomination process, the responsibilities of directors (including with respect to leadership development and management succession), meetings of non-management directors, and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines are available on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance and are available in print to any shareholder who requests them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may request copies free of charge from Investor Relations, Mettler-Toledo International Inc., 1900 Polaris Parkway, Columbus, OH 43240, USA, telephone +1 614 438 4748.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibility of the Board of Directors in Governance & Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company operates an ethics and compliance program that is designed to reinforce performance with integrity and compliance with the companys code of conduct and relevant laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is knowledgeable about the content and operation of the program so as to exercise reasonable oversight regarding the implementation and effectiveness of the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All actions of the companys Board of Directors, executive officers, and employees are governed by the companys code of conduct The board did not approve any waiver of the code of conduct by an executive officer or director in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the code of conduc is available at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance and is available in print to any shareholder who requests it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board is involved in the oversight of the companys risk management process as follows: Each year, the company conducts an enterprise risk assessment under the supervision of the Executive Vice President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full board receives the results of the assessment including an evaluation of risks and a description of actions taken by the company to mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews the results in detail and reports on its review to the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation-Related Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Compensation Committee have evaluated the companys compensation programs generally at different levels throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, we considered that for executives who have the largest potential incentive compensation, a significant portion of total compensation is comprised of stock options that vest over five years and have a ten-year life, which drives emphasis on long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also considered the applicability of the various situations described in Item 402(s) of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We concluded from our evaluation that risks arising from our compensation policies and practices for our employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS  GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum Qualifications for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Board of Directors must demonstrate integrity, reliability, knowledge of corporate affairs, and an ability to work well together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also consider diversity in business background, area of expertise, gender, and ethnicity when selecting board nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys corporate governance guidelines contain additional details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board uses the following criteria in evaluating independence:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) independence under the rules of the New York Stock Exchange; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) no relationships with the company (other than as a director or shareholder) or only immaterial relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independence criteria are contained in the companys corporate governance guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board solicits information from directors as to any relationship the director or his immediate family member has with the company that might affect the directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board also evaluates directors independence pursuant to current New York Stock Exchange rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that the following types of relationships are categorically immaterial:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commercial business relationships where METTLER TOLEDO buys from or sells to companies where directors serve as employees, or where their immediate family members serve as executive officers, and where the annual purchases or sales are less than the greater of $1 million or 2% of either companys consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of these criteria, the board has determined that Messrs. Chu, Contino, Francis, Kelly, Maerki, and Salice, and Ms. Harvey are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Spoerry, Chairman of the Board, and Mr. Filliol, President and Chief Executive Officer, are not independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting of Non-Employee Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board schedules regular executive sessions for its non-employee members, typically as part of each board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Presiding Director acts as chairman of these meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Board Meetings and the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board expects that its members will attend all meetings of the board and the annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors met four times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least 75% of all board and committee meetings of which the director is a member and all directors attended the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Limiting Director Service on Other Public Company Boards; Director Resignation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has adopted a policy that directors may not serve on more than five public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board also has a policy that directors will offer their resignation upon a change in professional position or in circumstances that might affect a directors ability to serve on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such circumstances, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee takes the lead on determining the appropriate course of action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Competencies; Self-Evaluation; Director Retirement Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has developed a competency matrix to identify relevant skills and help determine to what extent directors possess needed skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the board conducts a self-evaluation in which each individual director completes a self-evaluation with respect to the board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman then holds an individual discussion with each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consolidated results of the self- evaluation are then reviewed by the full board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS  GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a policy pursuant to which directors will not stand for reelection at the annual meeting that follows their 72nd birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In adopting this policy, the Board of Directors considered the importance of ensuring a mix of ages among board members and the balance of continuity versus fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Share Ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys equity ownership guidelines adopted in July 2009 call for non-employee Directors to hold company shares with a value equal to five times their cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman shall hold company shares with a value equal to five times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals have five years from their election to the board to satisfy this requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 all directors satisfied the ownership guidelines, and all directors nominated for reelection currently satisfy the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information provided in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis - Equity Ownership Guidelines, applies to director share ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contacting the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interested parties, including shareholders, may contact the Board of Directors, the Presiding Director individually, or the non- management directors as a group via: EMAIL to PresidingDirector@mt.com; or REGULAR MAIL to Mettler-Toledo International Inc., Im Langacher 44, 8606 Greifensee, Switzerland, Attention: Presiding Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman receives a salary and an option grant, participates in the various Swiss personnel insurances (pension plan, accident and disability insurance), and receives certain miscellaneous benefits described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other directors (except the CEO, Mr. Filliol, whose compensation is described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis) are compensated by an annual cash retainer, committee member fees, and per meeting fees for board and committee meetings attended Board members may also receive a $750 meeting fee for performing interviews of board candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are reimbursed for traveling costs and other out-of-pocket expenses incurred in attending board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors also receive an annua stock option grant and a grant of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following provides an overview of the elements of 2016 director compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Charters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee of the Board of Directors has a written charter setting forth the responsibilities of the committee in detail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charters are reviewed annually and updated as necessary to comply with relevant regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee charters can be found on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance and are available free of charge in print to any shareholder who requests them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of the committees are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit   Compensation   Nominating & Corporate Governance   Oversees the accounting and financial reporting process of the company     Discharges the responsibilities of the companys Board of Directors relating to compensation of the companys executives     Identifies, screens, and recommends qualified candidates to serve as directors of the company   Assists with board oversight of the integrity of the companys financial statements, and the sufficiency of the independent registered public accounting firms review of the companys financial statements     Reviews and monitors compensation arrangements so that the company continues to retain, attract, and motivate quality employees     Advises the board on the structure and membership of committees of the board   Assists with board oversight of the performance of the companys internal audit function     Reviews an annual report on executive compensation for inclusion in the companys proxy statement     Develops and recommends to the board corporate governance guidelines applicable to the company   Oversees the appointment, engagement, and performance of the companys independent registered public accounting firm     Reviews the Compensation Discussion and Analysis included in the companys proxy statement     Leads the board in its annual review of the boards performance   Assists with board oversight of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the board in overseeing the accounting and financial reporting processes of the company and audits of the financial statements of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates pursuant to a written charter, a copy of which can be found on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In discharging its oversight role, the Audit Committee discussed the audited financial statements contained in the 2016 annual report separately with the companys independent registered public accounting firm and the companys management and reviewed the companys internal controls and financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys independent registered public accounting firm, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC), is responsible for auditing the companys consolidated financial statements as well as the companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwC issues opinions as to (1) whether the financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position, results of operations and cash flows of the company and its subsidiaries in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America, and (2) whether the company maintained, in all material respects, effective control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audited Financial Statements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the companys audited financial statements with PwC, the Audit Committee discussed the matters required to be discussed by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Boards Auditing Standard No. 16, as amended, and other matters including, without limitation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwCs responsibilities under generally accepted auditing standards, including the nature and scope of their audits;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the written disclosures and confirming letter from PwC regarding their independence required under the Public Compan Accounting Oversight Board Rule 3526;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: certain matters regarding the companys accounting policies, practices, and estimates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the auditors evaluation of the quality of the companys financial reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: information related to significant unusual transactions, including the business rationale for such transactions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an overview of the overall audit strategy, including timing of the audit, significant risks the auditor identified, and significant changes to the planned audit strategy or identified risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any material weaknesses or significant deficiencies in internal controls over financial reporting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the extent of any significant accounting adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the companys audited financial statements with the companys management, the Audit Committee discussed the same topics listed above with management, including, without limitation, the process used by management in formulating accounting estimates and the reasonableness of those estimates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors, and the board approved, that the audited financial statements be included in the companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-audit services were approved in advance by the Audit Committee pursuant to the procedures described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Approval of Non-Audit Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee approves all non-audit services PwC provides in accordance with the following framework:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is considered to have pre-approved any project in an approved category that is less than $50,000 in fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific projects in excess of this amount and any potential projects not included in the pre-approval framework are presented to the Audit Committee Chairman for his advance approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a quarterly basis, PwC reports all non-audit services outside of the pre-approval framework to the Audit Committee and any proposals for non-audit services in the upcoming quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews all non-audit fees at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm ensures that all audit and non-audit services provided to the company have been approved by the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the companys management and the independent registered public accounting firm confirm to the Audit Committee that every non-audit service being proposed is permissible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL TWO: RATIFICATION OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM

sentences.text: You are being asked to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) as the companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed PwC, independent public accountants, to audit and report on the companys consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017 and to perform such other services as may be required of them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwCs appointment is ratified if a majority of votes cast, excluding abstentions, with respect to this proposal are voted FOR.

sentences.text: Representatives of PwC are expected to be present at the annual meeting.

sentences.text: We have no existing direct or indirect understandings or agreements with PwC that place a limit on current or future years audit fees.

sentences.text: Please see the Audit Committee Report above for further details concerning PwCs fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINATING AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee assists the board in identifying and recommending individuals to be nominated for election to the Board of Directors by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee is responsible for advising the board on the structure and membership of committees of the board as well as developing corporate governance guidelines applicable to the operation of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee operates pursuant to a written charter, a copy of which can be found on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We describe below the process the committee established to nominate directors to the Board of Directors as well as some of the committees recent corporate governance activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When there is an actual or anticipated board vacancy, candidates for the Board of Directors may be recommended by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) other board members,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) third parties engaged for that purpose by the committee, and/or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will consider shareholder recommendations and evaluate them in the same manner as other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders interested in recommending a person to be a director of the company must make such recommendation in writing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recommendation must be forwarded to the Secretary of the company at: Mettler-Toledo International Inc., Im Langacher 44, 8606 Greifensee, Switzerland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder recommendations must include the information and be sent within the time-frames specified in the companys by-laws, a copy of which can be obtained from the Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional details regarding minimum qualifications for director nominees can be found in the corporate governance guidelines on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee proceeds as follows in nominating candidates for a position on the companys Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) The committee begins by working with the Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer to determine the specific qualifications, qualities, and skills that are desired for potential candidates to fill the vacancy on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee makes this determination based upon the current composition of the board, the specific needs of the company in light of the director competency matrix, and the Minimum Qualifications for Directors included in the corporate governance guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These state that the Board of Directors should be composed of successful individuals who demonstrate integrity, reliability, knowledge of corporate affairs, a general understanding of the companys business, and an ability to work well together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee considers diversity in business background, area of expertise, gender, and ethnicity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also evaluates longer-term board succession, taking into account the demographics of respective board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will then compile a list of all candidates recommended to fill the vacancy on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates who meet the desired qualifications, qualities, and skills will be required to provide information regarding the candidates background, experience, independence, and other information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Members of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, the Chairman of the Board, the Chief Executive Officer, and, in appropriate cases, other board members, will interview those candidates who have completed the questionnaire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) Following these interviews, the full Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee considers the qualifications of each candidate to ensure that each candidate meets the specific qualities and skills that are desired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will propose to the Board of Directors for consideration a list of candidates qualified for the position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee evaluated changes in individual Directors professional status o evaluate their ability to continue serving on the board.

sentences.text: They also identified and interviewed candidates, and filled a vacancy on the board.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also oversaw the adoption of an amendment to the companys by- laws, whereby the company adopted proxy access.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary elements of our executive compensation program are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Element   Base salary   Cash incentive   Long-term incentive Frequency   Reviewed annually    Determined annually    Reviewed annually   Type   Cash    Cash    Equity   Performance Period   1 year    1 year     Options vest over 5 years; 3 year period for performance share units   Performance Measures   N/A    EPS, net cash flow, sales    Stock price appreciation, rTSR, EPS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers for 2016 were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ame   Title livier A. Filliol  President and Chief Executive Officer William P. Donnelly  Executive Vice President homas Caratsch  Head of Laboratory Marc de La Guronnire  Head of European and North American Market Organizations imon Kirk  Head of Product Inspection
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes our executive compensation program, focusing on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its duties, the Compensation Committee receives information and recommendations from the Chairman, the Head of Human Resources, and the Chief Executive Officer, and consults with outside compensation consultants as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing executive compensation policies the Compensation Committee considers, among other things, the results of the Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation from the prior years Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The result of last years advisory vote was very positive with 95% of votes cast in favor of the companys compensation of its named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses independent compensation consultant Pearl Meyer & Partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They provide market surveys of executive compensation in technology firms in comparable industries (including scientific instrument firms), which are considered in setting compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Compensation Committee Report for a discussion of the Committees review of Pearl Meyer & Partnerss independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 compensation market data provided by Pearl Meyer & Partners revealed certain gaps in both cash and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gaps were the result of strong growth in market capitalization, no or minimal increases in cash compensation over the last several years, and long-term incentive increases that were lower than market and peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflecting input from Pear Meyer & Partners on current market practices, the Compensation Committee generally determined to close the equity gaps by granting a new type of performance-based long-term incentive: performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance share units have a three-year performance period with cliff vesting and use relative total shareholder return as the performance measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over time, we expect abou a third of executive officers equity compensation to be made up of performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance grants further align executives interests with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee made no other material changes to its executive compensation policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of our executive compensation programs are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensure compensation reflects performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company links pay to performance in part by setting challenging, objectively measurable targets, and paying cash incentives designed to reward achievement of those targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, when performance is only at or below target, compensation tends to be below market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focus executives on achieving financial and operating objectives that provide long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does this in part by linking long-term compensation to the companys long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash incentive is also tied to relevant metrics, including growth in earnings per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align executives interests with those of the companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company does this with its long-term incentives, including various performance-based equity grants, and by enforcing the equity ownership guidelines described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain the best talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total compensation must be competitive in the global personnel market in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program follows best practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consult independent compensation consultants to ensure our executive compensation is in line with industry and market standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We deploy a mix of short and long-term incentives to ensure compensation aligns with performance and motivates long- term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term incentives include various performance-based equity incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an executive compensation clawback policy to ensure that amounts are not erroneously awarde
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain executive share ownership guidelines that align executives interests with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit directors and executives from hedging the ownership of company securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We responsibly manage the use of equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation is aligned with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we grew earnings per share by 13.9% despite a challenging global economic environment, due to managements growth initiatives, proactive gross margin expansion, and cost control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key components of 2016 executive compensation were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salaries  As part of cost measures implemented in response to the strengthening Swiss franc, our Swiss-based executives offered to reduce their base salaries by up to 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for the other named executive officers were moderately increased.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries in all cases were reviewed with salary market data, local market conditions, and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentives  The average target achievement for our named executive officers in 2016 was 110%, resulting in incentive payments of between 113% and 80% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives  The total value of equity granted to our named executive officers in 2016 (except Mr. Donnelly) increased to reflect gaps to market identified by market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee generally determined to close the gaps by making grants of performance share units in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of equity granted to Mr. Donnelly decreased to reflect his planned transition toward retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys compensation program consists of three main elements: base salary, an annual cash incentive, and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of executive compensation is performance-based, and is paid in the form of the annual cash incentive and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to ensure that the three main elements of compensation are carefully considered and fair, and that executives are motivated to further the interests of shareholders, both short-term and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the Compensation Committee separately reviews each of the three elements, as well as total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It takes into account the companys growth and performance, individual executive performance, and developments in the markets in which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the competitiveness of the companys executive compensation, the Compensation Committee periodically conducts both broad-based surveys of executive compensation and surveys of the compensation of executives in the instruments and electronics industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Pearl Meyer & Partners provided data using confidential surveys relating to CEO and senior executive compensation at technology companies in comparable industries, including scientific instruments firms, and firms of similar size to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also provided data on peer company compensation at Agilent Technologies, Inc., Ametek Inc., Bio- Rad Laboratories, Inc., IDEX Corporation, PerkinElmer Inc., Rockwell Automation Inc., Roper Technologies, Inc., Sartorius AG Waters Corporation, and Xylem Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also reviewed CEO compensation data from certain Swiss industria public companies of a similar size and international organizational structure as the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys goal is to pay base salaries that are approximately at or somewhat below the median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on market data, we believe base salaries for our executive officers are generally slightly lower than those at peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although a competitive base salary is necessary and appropriate to attract and retain high quality talent, we believe the majority of executive compensation should be paid in ways that link pay with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this through the annual cash incentive and long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in 2016 Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered its review of the salary market data referred to above, local market conditions, and individual performance in setting base salaries for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in light of the strengthening of the Swiss franc and cost measures taken in Switzerland, management offered to take voluntary pay cuts and the Compensation Committee agreed to reduce the cash compensation of Swiss-based executives by up to 5%, effective January 1, 2016 for the CEO, and effective April 1 for the other officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the 2016 base salary for Mr. Filliol decreased 5%, and the 2016 base salary for Messrs. Caratsch and Kirk decreased 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee increased the base salary for Mr. de La Guronnire by 2% and Mr. Donnelly by 1%, in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each case effective April 1st.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the quality of leadership of the management team, and the overall performance of the company, the committee believes managements compensation is appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We link pay with performance through our cash incentive plan, called POBS Plus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the incentive plan is to provide an incentive to key employees of the company to reward them for driving the success of the company as measured based on objective financial criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive plan is administered by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of each year, the Compensation Committee establishes the performance targets on which each participants incentive is based for the coming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targets used relate closely to our annual plan and budget, which are approved by the full Board of Directors each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targets are set taking into account the economic environment, the health of the companys end-user markets, and the challenges and opportunities of the companys various businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See 2016 Threshold, Target, Maximum, and Actual Performance below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, between 12 and 20 percent of the incentive for each participant in the POBS Plus incentive plan is based on individual objective performance targets relating to the companys annual business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee directly evaluates the Chief Executive Officers performance on his individual targets, and reviews the CEOs recommendation on the individual target performance of the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the audited results of the companys performance against each participants performance targets and determines the incentive payment, if any, earned by each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentive Payment as % of Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement vs. Target Levels ame  <90%   100% (Target)   130% (Maximum) Olivier A. Filliol       50%     169.4%  William P. Donnelly       45%     157.5%  Other Named Executive Officers       45%     160.5%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides that targets for 100% achievement should be challenging and ambitious, but also realistic and attainable such that it is possible to achieve and exceed them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The impact of over- or under-achieving targets on the annual incentive can be significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company and Board of Directors therefore approach the target setting process with care and consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe targets are set consistently with the philosophy of the POBS Plus plan that they be challenging and ambitious.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the last five years the average target achievement for the named executive officers was 104%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
