sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board believes it is good corporate governance and in the interests of shareholders to have a recoupment or clawback policy concerning incentive-based compensation, specifically with regard to the companys variable cash compensation, the POBS Plus plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a matter of basic fairness, the board wishes to correct for errors in the event of certain accounting restatements affecting incentive- based compensation to ensure that amounts are not erroneously awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2013, the board adopted a clawback policy that applies to all executive officers and certain other individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the ompany is required to prepare an accounting restatement due to the material noncompliance of the company with any financial eporting requirement under the securities laws (other than a restatement caused by a change in applicable accounting rules or nterpretations), the board will review the specific facts and circumstances and take such actions as it considers appropriate in its sole discretion with respect to the incentive-based compensation of covered individuals as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to POBS Plus cash incentives, the board will determine the amount that would have been due under the restated financial results, and whether to seek reimbursement of any excess amount that was paid (net of any taxes paid but taking into account any deductions that may be taken upon repayment) for cash incentives paid within the three-year period prior to the determination of the necessary restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Another method we have historically used to link pay with performance is awarding stock options, which we believe aligns managements long-term interests with those of the companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officers stock options generally vest over five years, 20% per year, starting on the first anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has also granted performance options with cliff vesting of five years or longer, including a grant of performance options to the CEO in 2016 described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All options have a term of ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect future grants will similarly have vesting schedules of five years and terms of ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 compensation market data provided by Pearl Meyer & Partners revealed certain gaps in both cash and long-term incentive compensation compared to market and peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gaps were the result of strong growth in market capitalization, no or minimal increases in cash compensation over the last several years, and long-term incentive increases that were lower than market and peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflecting input from Pearl Meyer & Partners on current market practices, the Compensation Committee generally determined to close the equity gaps by granting a new type of performance-based long-term incentive: performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gap in the CEOs cash compensation was addressed with performance stock options as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With these changes, a greater proportion of the named executive officers total compensation is being made in the form of long-term incentives that further align managements long-term interests with those of the companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each named executive officer received a target award of performance share units, under which the individual will earn shares of common stock in the future if certain performance conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys performance share units are based on relative total shareholder return (rTSR) over a three-year period, specifically, the companys relative performance against each of the companies that make up the S&P 500 Healthcare Index and the S&P 500 Industrials Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The units have three-year cliff vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company must achieve at least a 30th percentile performance for the performance share units to start vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The units will vest at 100% if the company achieves a 60th percentile performance, and the units will vest at 200% if the companys relative performance is at the 75th percentile or better.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting schedule is shown in this table (linear interpretation is applied between the points shown):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: rTSR Percentile Rank   Shares Earned as % of Target Threshold    30%      0%        45%      50%   Target    60%      100%        67.5%      150%   Maximum    75%      200%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting percentage of the performance share units is capped at 100% of target when the companys absolute TSR is negative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Mr. Filliols case, in 2016 the Compensation Committee additionally made a one-time grant of performance stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This one-time grant is intended to address an existing cash compensation gap that will not be closed with an increase in cash compensation over the coming 5-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance stock options have a five-year performance period and fully vest in 2022 if the service and performance conditions are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance stock options will only vest if the company has achieved at least 12% compound annual growth in its fully diluted earnings per share over the five year period from January 1, 2017 through December 31, 2021.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that at this time it would be appropriate for a greater proportion of the CEOs total compensation to be long-term performance-based and therefore decided to address his existing cash compensation gap with this one-time performance stock option grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the amount of each named executive officers equity grants, the Compensation Committee evaluates the relative importance of the individuals job, the contribution and performance of the individual, their years of service, and their total compensation, as well as competitive information about equity as described above relative to each individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, these factors led to the grant of equity with the grant date fair values each as described in the table Grant of Plan-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that past performance is just one factor to take into account in determining the size of future awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grant Practices and Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves all equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity grants are typically made once each year when the overall annual compensation review takes place (typically in late October or early November each year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and Board meeting dates are set several years in advance, and the grants are made on the meeting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, the Committee has also made initial grants to individual executive officers at the time they started serving as executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All options have an exercise price equal to the closing price of the companys shares on the New York Stock Exchange on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee feels it is important for senior executives to have a significant portion of their ongoing compensation tied to the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2009, the Compensation Committee implemented equity ownership guidelines for executive officers that call for the individuals to accumulate equity ownership as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ategory   Value of Equity Ownership Required EO   5x base salary xecutive Vice President and CFO   3x base salary Other executive officers   2x base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following types of equity count towards the ownership requirement: shares held directly, vested and unvested restricted stock units (if any), and the in-the-money value of vested stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals have five years from the date of appointment as an officer to meet the ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an individual does not meet the requirement within the relevant time periods, the Compensation Committee has the discretion not to make further equity grants to that person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an individual has met their requirement bu subsequently falls below due to a drop in share price, they will have 24 months to rebuild their ownership, subject to Compensation Committee discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All officers satisfy the equity ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Equity Hedging Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board and the companys executive officers are prohibited from any transaction hedging the ownership of company securities ncluding trading in publicly-traded options, puts, calls, or other derivative instruments that are directly related to company securities This policy does not apply to employees who are not executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Purchase Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2007, the board approved the Mettler-Toledo 2007 Share Purchase Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plan, executive officers may purchase company shares using all or a portion of their cash incentive payable under the POBS Plus plan, subject to approval of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The issue price for shares under the plan will be equal to the New York Stock Exchange closing price on the date of issuance, which occurs before March 15 of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares issued pursuant to the plan are restricted for a period of five years from the date of issuance, during which time they may not be sold, assigned, transferred, or otherwise disposed of, nor may they be pledged or otherwise hypothecated, except in the case of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Treatment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code prohibits the company from deducting compensation in excess of $1 million paid to certain employees, generally its CEO and its three other most highly compensated executive officers (excluding the CFO), unless that compensation qualifies as performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain flexibility to balance the need to fairly compensate the companys executive officers with the companys ability to deduct compensation pursuant to Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Equalization Agreements (Swiss Executives)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is a party to tax equalization agreements with Messrs. Caratsch, Filliol, and Kirk, who are non-U.S. citizens and non- U.S. residents and who pay income tax on their earnings in Switzerland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individuals do not receive any cash benefit from the agreements, the principle of which is to leave the employee in exactly the same position (i.e., no better and no worse off) as if they had not become subject to U.S. taxation on a portion of their income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the tax equalization agreements, the company has agreed to pay taxes borne by these executives in respect of incremental taxation being due in the United States by virtue of their work for the company there.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the individuals are left no better and no worse off than had they not become subject to U.S. taxation, the Compensation Committee does not believe it is appropriate to take into account the U.S. taxes paid by the company under the tax equalization agreements when determining the employees compensation each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In cases where the individuals Swiss taxes are lower as a result of the company having paid these U.S. tax amounts, the individual must make a payment to the company under the tax equalization agreement.

sentences.text: The agreements have no fixed term but may be terminated without cause by either party on 12 months notice, during which period the executive is entitled to full compensation under the agreement, including payment of base salary, target cash incentive, and continuation of benefits.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assists the board in reviewing and monitoring the compensation of the companys executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee operates pursuant to a written charter, a copy of which can be found on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for establishing compensation arrangements that allow the company to retain, attract and motivate highly qualified employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the companys total compensation budget, and sets the annual compensation of the companys executive officers, including the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also evaluates and sets the compensation of the directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its duties, the Compensation Committee receives input and recommendations from the Chairman, Head of Human Resources, and the Chief Executive Officer regarding the amount and form of executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Compensation Committee has the sole authority to retain, terminate, obtain advice from, oversee, and compensate its outside advisors, including its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has provided appropriate funding to the Committee to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee retained Pearl Meyer & Partners (PM&P) as its independent executive compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM&P reports directly to the Compensation Committee, and the Compensation Committee may replace PM&P or hire additional consultants at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM&P attends meetings of the Compensation Committee, as requested, and communicates with the Chair of the Compensation Committee between meetings; however, the Compensation Committee makes all decisions regarding the compensation of the companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM&P provides various executive compensation services to the Compensation Committee at its request with respect to the companys executive officers and other key employees, as well as the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The services PM&P provides include advising the Compensation Committee on the principal aspects of the executive compensation program and evolving best practices, and providing market information and analysis regarding the competitiveness of the companys program design and awards in relation to the companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews the services provided by its outside consultants and believes that PM&P is independent in providing executive compensation consulting services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee conducted a specific review of its relationship with PM&P, and determined that PM&Ps work for the Committee in 2016 did not raise any conflicts of interest, consistent with the guidance provided under the Dodd-Frank Act, or applicable rules and regulations of the SEC and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the Compensation Committee noted that during 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM&P did not provide any services to the company or its management other than service to the Compensation Committee, and its services were limited to executive compensation consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, it did not provide, directly or indirectly through affiliates, any non-executive compensation services, including, but not limited to, pension consulting or human resource outsourcing;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees from the company were less than 1% of PM&Ps total revenue during the year of 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM&P maintains a Conflicts Policy, which was provided to the Compensation Committee, with specific policies and procedure designed to ensure independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL THREE: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act enacted in July 2010 (the Dodd-Frank Act), the shareholders of the company are entitled to vote at the annual meeting to approve the compensation of the companys named executive officers, as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K under the Securities Act and the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described more fully in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement and accompanying tables and narratives, our compensation program consists of three main elements: base salary, an annual cash incentive, and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to ensure that the three main elements of compensation are carefully considered and fair, and that executives are motivated to further the interests of shareholders, both short-term and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has in the past sought approval from shareholders regarding the incentive plans that we use to motivate, retain, and reward our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those incentive plans, including the POBS Plus Incentive System for Group Management and the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, make up a majority of the pay that the company provides to our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a long track record of delivering superior results for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the 15 year period ending December 31, 2016, the companys total return to shareholders has been 707%, compared with 164% for the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation programs have played a material role in our ability to drive strong financial results and attract and retain a highly qualified team to run the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation programs are transparent, consistent with current best practices, appropriately benchmarked to peers, and effective in supporting our company and our business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are substantially tied to the achievement of key business objectives and to long-term shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both our short-term and our long-term incentives are performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance is objectively measured.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets are set at challenging levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted to executives have a ten-year term and vest over five years, which helps management focus on sustainable and long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We carefully monitor the compensation of executives from companies of similar size and complexity to help us to ensure our programs are within the range of market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company seeks your advisory vote on our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder advisory votes on our executive compensation programs will occur annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders the next such shareholder advisory vote will occur at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ask that you support the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and the accompanying tables and narratives contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the board will review the voting results and take such results into consideration when making future decisions regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we ask our shareholders to vote FOR the following resolution at the annual meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the compensation paid to the companys named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narrative discussion, is hereby APPROVED.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the approval of the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement pursuant to the compensation and disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL FOUR: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF ADVISORY VOTES TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Act requires us, not less frequently than once every six years, to provide our shareholders a separate non-binding advisory vote on the frequency of submission to shareholders of a Say on Pay advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to the Securities and Exchange Commissions compensation and disclosure rules, such as Proposal Three.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we are asking shareholders to vote on whether the advisory vote should occur every three years, every two years, or every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is advisory, and will not be binding on the company, our Board of Directors or our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board of Directors will consider the voting results, it may ultimately decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and the company to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation on a different schedule than the option approved by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote for your preferred frequency by indicating your choice that future Say on Pay Proposals should be submitted to shareholders every three years, every two years, or every year, or you may choose to abstain from voting on this issue, in response to the resolution set forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that whichever of the three frequency choices of: every three years, every two years or every year receives the most shareholder votes will be considered the shareholders preferred frequency in regard to how often a Say on Pay Proposal should be submitted to the shareholders in future company proxy statements prepared in connection with our annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no voting specification (for every three years, every two years, every year or an abstention from voting) is made, your vote will count as a vote for a frequency of every year for the future non-binding shareholder vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires the companys executive officers and directors, and persons who own more than ten percent of a registered class of the companys equity securities, to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) and The New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers, directors and greater than 10% shareholders are required by SEC regulation to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our review of the copies of such forms we received, or written representations from certain reporting persons, we believe that in the las fiscal year all filing requirements applicable to our executive officers and directors and greater than 10% shareholders were complied with.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Availability of Form 10-K and Annual Report to Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys Annual Report to shareholders for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, including financial statements, accompanies this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report is not to be regarded as proxy soliciting material or as a communication by means of which any solicitation is to be made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report is available on the companys website at www.mt.com under About Us/Investor Relations/Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon written request, the company will furnish, without charge, to each person whose proxy is being solicited a copy of the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, as filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests in writing for copies of any such materials should be directed to Investor Relations, Mettler-Toledo International Inc., 1900 Polaris Parkway, Columbus, Ohio 43240- 2020, USA, telephone +1 614 438 4748.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electronic Delivery of Annual Report and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive future annual reports, proxy statements and other materials, and shareholder communications electronically via the Internet, please follow the directions on your proxy card for requesting such electronic delivery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An election to receive materials electronically will continue until you revoke it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will continue to have the option to vote your shares by mail, by telephone, or via the Internet.

sentences.text: How to Submit Shareholder Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may present proposals which may be proper subjects for inclusion in the proxy statement and for consideration at an annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be considered, proposals must be submitted on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We must receive proposals for next years annual meeting no later than November 15, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals and questions related thereto should be submitted in writing to the Secretary of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals may be included in the proxy statement for next years annual meeting if they comply with certain rules and regulations promulgated by the SEC and in connection with certain procedures described in our by-laws, a copy of which may be obtained from the Secretary of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposal submitted outside the processes of these rules and regulations will be considered untimely for the purposes of Rule 14a-4 and Rule 14a-5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivery of Documents to Shareholders Sharing an Address
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner, but not the record holder, of shares of METTLER TOLEDO stock, your broker, bank, or other nominee may only deliver one copy of this proxy statement and our 2016 annual report to multiple shareholders who share an address unless that nominee has received contrary instructions from one or more of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will deliver promptly, upon written or oral request, a separate copy of this proxy statement and our 2016 annual report to a shareholder at a shared address to which a single copy of the documents was delivered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder who wishes to receive a separate copy of the proxy statement and annual report should submit this request by writing to Investor Relations, Mettler-Toledo International Inc., 1900 Polaris Parkway, Columbus, OH 43240, USA or by calling +1 614 438 4748.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders sharing an address who are receiving multiple copies of proxy materials and annual reports and who wish to receive a single copy of such materials in the future should contact their broker, bank, or other nominee to request that only a single copy of each document be mailed to all shareholders at the shared address in the future.
